description: I had a good time coming to Burger King on the day of my birthday with a delicious Whopper Jr with a side of fries and Hi- C. What made the experience better was the nice, friendly receptionist that made my day even better. Thank you Burger King.
author: Leo C.

description:
As a kid, teenager, adult and still to this day... I still enjoy myself by going to this Burger King of Downtown San Francisco Ca!!! 

I like going to this Burger king on my day off or before going work for a quick snack!!! And the best thing that I really like most about Burger King is the coupon that has the Mix And Match offer!!! And just to let you know that most times that this Burger King of Downtown San Francisco,Ca does usually get crowded with a lot of tourist so prepare yourself to see a big line!!!

My most favorite thing that... I really enjoy eating the most at this Burger King of Downtown San Francisco Ca is the... 

Burger King Ultimate Breakfast Platter
Burger King Big Fish Sandwich
Original Chicken Sandwich
Whopper W/ Cheese
French Fries With out the Salt
Onion Rings
Cheesy Tots
Chicken Nuggets
author: William B.

description:
Probably one of the worst BK branches I've ever been to. The food was ok but everything else was just bad. This place needs a serious makeover plus they need to figure out a way to keep the bums outside. I mean, if I could, I would help each one of these poor people but this needs to be done in a certain way that will keep them out. I mean this place has practically became a homeless shelter and I seriously didn't feel safe. Other reviews here say there is a security guard, I didn't see one or at least didn't feel the presence of one. I basically took my sandwich and went out because I didn't want to stay in there. Also, they gave me a receipt with just the total, not the items and I only found out when i was too far to come back. Please make sure you hand the right receipt.
There are very nice, clean and modern BK branches all over the world. Recently I happened to be in a BK branch in the Madrid airport which is even hard to believe is the same chain as this.
author: Gil S.

description:
I went to this Burger King earlier today on my lunch break around 5:30pm. After I ordered my food, I was standing next to the security guard waiting for my order to be called. The guard walks over to a cleaning station and uses one of the sanitized table rags to wipe down his boots. I could not believe what I was seeing, I was so disgusted and then he put the rag back in its place. 

After about 2 more minutes of waiting, the employee calls my number. I grabbed the rag he used from the table and took it with me to the counter while getting my food. I put the rag on the counter and told the employee what the security guard had done. She seemed a little confused; I don't know if she understood English very well. At that point, I was starting to get a little irritated so I just grabbed my food and left. I will never return to this Burger King again. And I will be calling corporate!!!
author: Jane S.

description:
When I go here, I get the 2/$5.00 deals. You can mix your combos: extra long cheeseburger, chicken sandwich, fish sandwich or whopper. 

*I no longer eat at this establishment. They no longer have the 2/$5.00 deals and even when you inquire about it, the cashiers don't bother to tell you about the 2/$6.00 deal posted outside on the stand. I'd noticed the last time here that they use rancid oil as their fries are a clear sign that they do, they're nasty.
author: Kim L.

description:
Food quality wise this location is mediocre. Something tasted kinda off about their Whopper tonite. Smelled kinda funky for one. Did they leave it out too long? I dunno...I ate half of it then spat the rest and threw it out ,and thought, I had better tasting Whoppers than this. Weird. The double bacon cheeseburger tasted slightly better. I haven't even touched the onion rings yet. Maybe I'll change my mind later and give it a three star rating but right now I'm feeling it's just a two.

edit:Tasted better after the microwave reheat for some reason.
author: Isabella A.

description:
Up until the time they stopped honoring franchise coupons I liked this place.  Competent workers, orders filled correctly.  

Today I went in only to be told they would not honor coupons. 

Would love to hear from the management on their thinking about this ill advised step.
 
This seems to be a way to pull in more money by soaking the tourists and a big FU to SF residents since I'm sure most people on vacation are not traveling with coupons.  Way to NOT support the community that hosts you.

I won't be back.
author: Aj D.

description: This place no longer accepts coupons /meal deal vouchers since 3 July. Very unprofessional as vouchers didn't state exception to this location. Not sure why but if you like paying full price for not very good fast food then go to this place otherwise try nearby Jack in the box, McDonalds. Won't come here again.
author: W Y.

description: Good burgers. Ice cream also. I remembered I was in it after a rain shower and everyone were polite and nobody asked me what happened. They are very fair and it's a clean restaurant.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
Not too much expected from a fast food restaurant. It was super interesting seeing all walks of life walking into the place. People ranging from post-club go-ers, to homeless individuals, to the mother with her baby...

This Burger King is located next to the MAC and Sephora store around Union Square. There is plenty of seating and a sort of fluorescent glow upon walking in. After ordering, of course, the food came out quickly, staff was friendly. I can't complain about any of it!

For a meal that was less than $6, I got a 10 piece chicken nugget and a Whopper Jr. Not to shabby any of it! I actually feel like the nuggets tasted pretty good :). A good place to grab a bite when you're on a time and financial crunch!
author: Stephanie F.

description: The in house security needs to do a better job. I ordered some breakfast and as I started to eat. Some guy just walked by and asked if I am done because he wanted the leftovers. I had just taken my first bite and he hovered over me like a vulture. It was a very awkward feeling.
author: Moe S.

description: I enjoy Burger King, I prefer the one in my neighborhood cause for some reason other places just don't get it right. Like this location! Smh. I order a king rodeo meal, medium size with a Dr. pepper. Guess the lady at the register doesn't know what she's doing. What I get is a large Diet Coke (disgusting) and a king bacon burger smh. Then I point out twice that they've messed up my order and the lady didn't even want to take it back and fix it. Guess I'm won't be coming back here until they learn how to really train their workers
author: Monique S.

description: Fast, fun, friendly service. Delicious, warm fast food. What more can one ask for? Cashiers were very sweet towards me and patient when my Apple Pay was not working. Security guard was sweet as well and daddy af... ^^ overall very happy with my visit today!
author: Andy S.

description: If I can give this a zero I would but this place is pretty much a typical Burger King however expect the following: homeless, poor service, (they don't repeat your order to you), have to pay for refills (most Burger King locations don't charge you), and lastly, if your on there for more then expected some workers will give you a stare like as if they don't want you here. STAY AWAY UNLESS YOU WANT A BETTER PLACE THAN CIVIC CENTER LOCATION
author: David R.

description:
Burger KIng is huge in space, lots of dining area. order area in front. not much interest in BK lately. only new item MacCheese something. usuallly out.

spotted standing board with $1 softie cone notice.
not as good as Frosties but a good value
-no doubt mostly chemicals, little dairy products.
author: Victor G.

description: Work in the area. I go there often bc its the cheapest and fastest. Not necessarily the healthiest. The security guard is an asshole and take his job way too serious. I realize what he has to deal with since I'm in the same line of work. But, come on theres no need to be an asshole just because you wear a rented uniform. Foods like every other fast food place, security guard thinks he's a cop. Lol
author: Ale V.

description: This Burger King really stands out compared to others. It is right on Powell street, which really adds to the experience. The service is almost always fast and the food is much more neatly prepared than the McDonald's next door. This Burger King is a great place to go if you are on the go and hungry
author: Bob B.

description:
Came here while shopping and Pokemon hunting, and wanted to grab a bite before heading back to the office. So just wanted something simple and what better than the 10 piece nuggets for $1.49. So I waited in line and made my order.

After asking if I wanted anything else, the cashier told me my total was $3.24 and that the nuggets were $2.99 for the 10 piece. I said thank you, but no thank you. This was literally, twice the advertised amount. Apparently this location doesn't follow advertised prices. 

I went back to office and grabbed my nuggets at Civic Center for $1.49.
author: M C.

description: Very close to transit and a large dining area. Lines can get long. They no longer take coupons of any kind and don't participate in national promotions to my knowledge. No free refills either. Boo!
author: Michael C.

description:
It is a huge room for customers, excellent customer service. Just maintain the place clean as possible. 

Overall. It's good.
author: Carolina A.

description:
This used to be the "scary" Burger King where the hobos hung out that no one went to when you were walking to Uniqlo to get some cheap shirts on the way from Bart. You always thought it was pretty cool since it had arcade games in there but you never wanted to go in since it looked hella sketch.

Then things changed.

Some time after, this Burger King got renovated, and now, it looks a lot cleaner, even if it has the same people plus or minus a few Asian families.

I decided I was craving Burger King today, primarily because I've been on Facebook and all they kept showing me was Chicken Fries and the Dr. Pepper shake, and that had me really thinking, "Can anyone do a Dr. Pepper Shake?"

I knew I had to find out.

I went to order, and I saw that there was also an Angriest Burger. I honestly wasn't that hungry, but I decided to just order that plus the chicken fries and shake. The total came out to be $14.97. I just spent $15 on Burger King. That's basically how much I would spend on real food in San Francisco, or the equivalent of $15 McChickens back when they were $1 on the dollar menu give or take a McChicken because of tax. 

Anyway, before starting any good Burger King meal, I knew I had to locate the restrooms. I found the bathrooms, and noticed that you had to pay 25 cents to use it. As someone who refuses to carry cash, I was screwed. I guess it exists to dissuade hobos from building a fort or something in there. Luckily, right as I went to the door a nice Asian lady and her young son came out and held the door open for me, and it was one of those cosmic moments where you see someone in need and you know it's the right thing to help them out and she came in and helped me out. This gives me hope in this world.

When I came out from the restroom, my meal was ready, and I was ready to eat. As I took my seat, to the left of me was an Asian family bickering about who to order, and the younger boy was like, "I'm a kid I don't have to order. You're a teenager so you have to order." But the mother made her two kids order. They were probably staring at me like a strange human being since I had three huge items and I was by myself.

I started with the Angriest Burger. I've gotta say it couldn't even be classified as an Angry Burger.

Then I got to the chicken fries. They weren't as good as I remembered them in my youth, and I was basically stuffed with the so-called Angriest Burger.

Then I grabbed the Dr. Pepper Shake for to-go. I was amazed that it tasted like Dr. Pepper, but it's one of those things where you'd rather have an actual Dr. Pepper. So on a scale from 1-10, I would rate it "It tastes like Dr. Pepper but you'd rather have an actual Dr. Pepper."

Overall, it was a good experience, and sometimes, it's not about the food, but the journey, that makes a restaurant memorable.

TIP: Get the Dr. Pepper shake. It's interesting and worth giving a try if you consider yourself any sort of fan of Dr. Pepper.
author: Brian L.

description: Wow. One would think that going to a fast food place would at least be uniform. Meaning that they'd follow some sort of standards set by their parent/corporate company. Newsflash: nope. What a mess this place is. I was charged extra for pickles, while I asked for the lettuce and onion to be removed. So much for having it my way for the price they offered. Wasn't told it would cost more...in fact the woman barely spoke English. When I asked her what was on the Chicken Sandwich, she looked at me blankly. When I got my Whopper, it was smothered in white sauce...absolutely disgusting. We're talking extra extra...no standards whatsoever. So far apart from their parent company, it should even be called Burger King. The Chicken Sandwich was similarly disgusting. Overcooked. Tasted nothing like the sandwich it should have tasted like. The bun was stale...as if it had been out for over eight hours. It didn't taste like any sort of recognizable chicken and was a ruined sandwich. To top it off, they charged me for a bag when I told them I didn't want one AND they don't accept Burger King coupons...a true example of a place that has the logo, may purchase from the distributers, but says forget quality. Forget about the reason you bought a chain in the first place. Forget about repeat customers. They only care about tourists that won't return. The place is called with homeless and the smell of urine and body odor fills the place. THEY. DO. NOT. CARE.
author: Jason S.

description:
6/30/2017- Indian/philapino look like young teenage lady very rude and impatient reason her shift was almost ending I was the last person to be served, she was so mean, impatient, really wanted to get off work so badly, just because I didn't hear her the first time while was getting something out of my bag she yelled, raised her voice at me, started to rush me so she can finish up with me in order get off work fast very immature childish high school ways I complained to the white security guard there he did not say anything to the girl even if he did I bet she didn't hear consider guy voice was so low, when standing in line before security was staring at me like I'm going to do something bad but turned out the other way around guy saw went behind the wall pretended saw nothing when complained about employee did nothing guess care more about them than customer, so what they are paying you you're supposed do right thing not the wrong.
After this had happened, I saw another girl philapino talked to her about this issue they didn't fix the issue started whispering to each other like bunch of little high school girls then taking my receipt without me keeping like is there's to begin with which it's not for them to take or ask customers if they want their receipt, receipts are for customers to keep isn't opposite for you to handle on your own, customers should not have to answer to the likes of you punks, bunch of ratchet girls with weird security guy don't know anything I'm taking my business somewhere else they obvious care more about themselves then strangers itself Me, Me, Me Technology idiot young kids generations up in this place avoid going here at all cost even for a simple burger, drink, whatever, seriously no matter what.
author: Lorrie T.

description: Nasty as hell! I found a roach next to me its so gross food is shit and i hate it never come here.
author: Franchesca L.

description: Do not go to this location it is a central location for pick pocketing. I had a brand new $1k phone stolen out of my bag in the blink of an eye and with so many riff raff around you can't discern who's a customer and who's stealing.
author: N A.

description:
This could've gone a lot better if the cashier didn't have me repeat everything like 3 times.
All I wanted was an iced coffee and French toast sticks. 
Seriously? I needed this to be quicker. And don't be rude and twist up your face and say "huh?" As if I'm speaking a different language when you're the one that wasn't paying close enough attention the first time. Customer service 101: "I'm sorry, what was that?" Or something more polite than a "huh?"
I'm giving this place a 3 because the food got out relatively quick, there's a lot of open seats, and this place is clean. If it wasn't for the sake of convenience that this place is by Bart I wouldn't come back.
author: Bianca M.

description: To be completely honest with you the people that work at this Burger King don't listen when you give your order. Then tell you it's your fault for not speaking up when I clearly was. They messed up on my order and when I ask if she could fix it because it was wrong  then the manger step in and fixed but then told the girl to give me one Sauce to my order when I had over 20 pieces of chicken nuggets for me and my friend. When I ask for another she said I gave you a lot already. The only reason Im giving it a star is because it won't let me post the review.
author: Melanie S.

description: Went in at 10:30 pm got the big fish meal. Fries were not good and fish sandwich was lacking in all areas. Tasted more salt than fish & fries.
author: M T.

description:
It's a shame that places like this get by entirely on ripping off tourists.

I haven't written a review in a very long time, but this morning incensed me. I just wanted a cheap mouthful of caffeine on my march up Powell St. to the office.

I asked for a small black coffee and she said that will be $2.19. I pointed at the menu which says small coffee is $1. She replied that is the senior price,  and I pointed out that on the menu, it says small and nothing of age restrictions. She unapologetically told me that all Burger Kings use the same menu, but they charge more.

So, if I had ordered a second item, I probably wouldn't have even noticed that they charge more than double the price listed on their menu and refuse to honor their own posted prices, which isn't legal, not to mention shamefully dishonest and unethical.
author: Quinn S.

description: We are here for the women's march. Really had to pee. We stopped off here, bought some fries and they made us pay to use the public restrooms. Security guard stood by to Ensure that each Customer paid to get into the potty! The place is only 20% full so this is bullshit. Especially considering the spirit of those who are marching for equal rights for all! C'mon! Everybody Pees!
author: Corrinne L.

description: Ordered 2 burgers,  the 1st one was ok,  the 2nd was kinda weird, take a look at the picture. Duuuuuude, is that a new burger?
author: Lino M.

description:
The place is better than all the burger kings in the city 
But I waited for the third time before writing this review 
Their problem is wrong orders 
The new hotdog have a good quality beef which is I like 
And they have a very good iced mocha coffee which I founded it very uniquely made and different than other coffees
author: Mustafa A.

description:
We love McDonald's breakfast menu - probably one of the best ones in the fast food industry.  Having never tried Burger King's breakfast menu before, we were really excited to use our breakfast menus we got in the mail.

One coupon was for 2 Croissan'wich, 1 small hash brown, and 1 small coffee for $4.  I really liked the croissan'wich a lot.  It tasted pretty good, comes with egg, cheddar cheese, sausage patty, and light croissant buns.  I'd say it's better than an egg mcmuffin.  The bun is a little on the soft side, but I still enjoyed it.  However, my gf says it's too soft and oily.  The croissant absorbs too much oil.  She rather have an egg mcmuffin.

The other coupon was for 1 order of french toast sticks with maple syrup for $1.  I didn't like the french toast.  The texture is good though - crispy outside and soft inside.  The syrup is on the runny side - not as thick as I would like.  There's a hint of cinnamon taste on the sticks which I really don't like.  It's too sweet and cinnamony.  My gf really liked it though, she recommends you guys try it out!

The newly rennovated place is nice looking.  Drinks are not self serve, but it's a nice big area.  The staff was friendly.  Despite being in an area where all the homeless people roam around, there weren't any inside at least at the time we went - like 7:30AM.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Probably the worst fast food experience of my life. It was apparent that every single employee there absolutely hated their job because it was obvious from their demeanor and attitude.

Simply asking for something made me feel like it was wrong. Like I was asking for a foot  massage and teeth clean.

I would suggest steering clear from this place at all cost unless you enjoy a bad experience and witnessing employees gossiping about customers in Tagalog.
author: Lux S.

description: Food poisoning? Food that looks worse than trash? "Security" is an -hole? Yaaaay! :)
author: Kaye S.

description:
It feels like every chain restaurant gets hated on, but this one is kind of justified. The food is a bit hit or miss. One day I'll get heavenly chicken fries and the next day I'll want to toss it all away in anger. 

The lines are almost always long and service comes out slowly for a fast food chain (to be expected based on crowd size though). They don't have time to care about you, but it's Burger King in one of the heaviest tourist areas of SF so what's there really to complain about?
author: Lani C.

description:
Came here to get my burger fix.

This location, being located in the downtown core, is definitely on the beaten up side.  With that said, it's quite spacious inside.  Lots of seating.

The staff were quite helpful - one even pointed to me that I shouldn't leave my wallet on the table.  Guess there's a bit of petty crime at this location.

The food was average, as expected.  One special thing about this location is the small cluster of 1980s coin-op arcade machines.  When I was there it was Pole Position, Millipede, and Pac Man's Arcade Party.  I would've gladly spent some money, except that the machines were 50c!?  The quarters went back into my pocket.
author: Edward L.

description:
The décor is circa 1990.  Looks like bill cosbys sweater or the taco bell of the future in demolition man.  Maybe wesley snipes is part owner and helped with the interior decorating

I had a whopper and small fries and tap water..$7.87.  Nice

Was tasty. McDonalds got nothing on BK
author: Asper K.

description: This place is terrible. I can't tell if Burger King's chicken nuggets are disgusting or if it's only disgusting here...regardless, this place is terrible but it's probably because it's catered for tourists.
author: Margaret R.

description: Nastiest Dirtiest straight up most funkiest restaurant in da world.  Surprised that the health department  allows this place to be in business
author: Rob J.

description:
Everything I said about this place and the surrounding area including my tips on alternates and nearby bathrooms for the kids in my prior review remain true so you might want to read it too...

But this place is still closed remodeling after a fire - it must have been a 9 alarm fire to keep them closed so long - or possibly they are assuming if they stay closed nearly forever the street people who lived in there and who make their living harassing tourists for money would die off before they re-open?

When you consider this possibility it might be a reasonable business plan...

BUT

If I were you I'd do what the Navy Aviators do when they are waived off from landing on a carrier in bad weather - land at another place....

Take my words to the wise seriously and keep your cell phone out of sight in this neighborhood unless you want to see it for sale on Craigslist along with your Google Purse!

ALSO

A word to the wise to the gentlemen who read this - I would never, ever carry my wallet in my back pocket in this neighborhood either!
author: Dalt W.

description:
My goodness so many negative reviews.  True, there are folks across every spectrum of society who either are eating here or just hanging out.  When you enter, it's somewhat taunting as the order counter is deep in the back of the restaurant.  Just walk straight in with self assurance.  

It's a mix of tourists and locals who come here as it's located by the cable car turnaround and the Westfield shopping center downtown.  I always take my order to go.

They've now got a turkey burger offering posted as a menu option.

Service is quick.
author: Shirley N.

description:
This is the most disgusting place I have ever been to. It's in the center of San Francisco, right next to the Iconic Powell Street cable car stop and Bart.

Pros:
+Location

Cons:
-Horrible Decor
-Smells Terrible
-Bad Service
-Restrooms cost $0.25!
-Filled with unpleasant people

AVOID THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GO BACK TO THE 80s! And throw up.
author: Christoph F.

description: I was positively impressed with the hot dog. Although the relish was too sweet for my taste, the dog itself was pretty decent. I didn't like the vibe from this place, though. Some weird people and a huge "decorationless" room makes it seem like a madhouse. It was fun to see a pac-man arcade there.
author: Lucas C.

description: I'm impressed at how active the security guard is and I'm solely leaving a review on his dedicated effort to keep Burger King a safe place through all the foot traffic that occurs downtown.
author: Frank C.

description: I used the BK app to get 2 whoppers 2 fries and 2 drinks for $8.99. I asked that whopper (1) have no onions, add bacon and cheese. On whopper (2) I asked that it only have tomatoes and pickles, add BBQ sauce and bacon. Then I ordered the tender grill chicken sandwich combo. Whopper (1)  ONLY had cheese and bacon on it. Whopper (2) HAD lettuce and cheese added to it. Instead of the tender grill sandwich, they gave us something called a "Chicken Burger".  When my wife called to speak to the manager concerning our order that we'd brought all the way home, the 'so called' manager tried to insinuate that we were being dishonest about the errors of our order. Basically, they felt we should get back out in the rain to bring them the food to prove our point. I live 1/2 mile from 35 Powell St. It's raining. If they can't take my word for stating the errors they made, I can just simply eat elsewhere next time.  I won't be going back here.
author: Damon W.

description: This place was decent at first until I ordered my meal. The meal was a bit overpriced and they charged you for everything, even for small cup of water. They even charged u for getting a sauce for ur meal that you had already bought. I wouldn't recommend this place at all.
author: Mark M.

description:
I believe this BK is a little more $$ and they make the food shittier. They are a higher volume location because of the tourist traffic there.. but this is probably one of the very worst BK I have ever been to..
Its a major hassle to just use the bathroom.
author: Tim V.

description: Avoid at all cost! They refuse to take coupons that are clearly marked for all burger kings. Went to another burger king and they accepted it. So much for grand opening this place still reeks of terrible service
author: Christopher C.

description:
I placed an order for a turkey burger and fries.  The order ended up taking over 20 minutes to prepare.  After waiting 10 minutes, I approached the counter and asked a worker named Rose how long it would take, and she rudely responded by saying 5 minutes.  5 minutes and another 5 minutes would past and I was not told how long to wait and was falsely misled.  After waiting 20 minutes I wanted a refund for my burger and again Rose rudely returned my money without even a slight apology or a thank you.  I eventually received my order of fries but was too upset to eat it.  

This location may be accustomed to serving tourist that may never come back and homeless, but as a local who frequents this location expect better service, and after this experience I will never step foot in this establishment and will tell my fellow San Franciscans to do the same.  

The service is horrible, and the staff needs to be rehired or retrained to treat customers with respect.

ROSE YOU ARE THEEE WORST SERVER EVER, you are in a country that prides itself on customer service and you need a reality check ( or slap).
author: Steph Q.

description:
This location does not accept those coupons they send in the mail. Also they charged me regular price on a $1 promo for their Icees. And they are stingy with the amount of fries that go into an order.
However, +1 star for being huge and moderately clean. Though now that I think about it I'm on the fence about that star since I saw the manager taking off his shoe in front of customers.
author: Karen C.

description: This place is huge! and yes it is the nearest Burger King in this popular Powell area. The only downside is that it is very easy for homeless people to come in and bother you while you eat. They also have security everywhere which I'm not sure if that should make me feel safe or just the fact that there are so many make me feel unsafe that they are there for a reason.
author: Diana C.

description: Apparently, people who review this fast food restaurant have no idea that people NEVER read Yelp reviews of Burger King.
author: Brian C.

description:
This is one of the best Burger King in San Francisco.

- Friendly staff members
- Clean facility
- Good service
author: Bennett W.

description:
Just one word: TERRIBLE 

Inside isn't clean.  Staffs ain't smiling. Toilets are disgusting. If you take out , not problem.
author: Serhat T.

description:
A dismal decaying food joint that reeks of despair. Fortunately for Burger King there was a grease fire and it has now been closed for months. It is currently undergoing renovations and I imagine they are not going to go past Black Friday before opening. Here is my sincerest recommendation for you, Burger King. Keep the street people out. Don't let the same 20 old people come in there and eat the food that they are plainly bringing in themselves and then just hanging out for hours. Don't put your bathrooms in that hallway again. And triple or quadruple your security until these elements get the message to stay out. This is a restaurant. Not a mental hospital or a shooting gallery for the area junkies. Seriously, do not let it just be as it was. This restaurant contributed a really bad impression to tourists from all over the world with its incredibly hideous decor and horrifying displays of mental illness.

I'll visit when they open, give it a month and update my review. Please be successful Burger King. I really want a Whopper.
author: Christopher R.

description: Won't understand all those 2 star reviews. You get tasty burgers and great fries for excellent price. Love it, and will always come back to BK
author: Ido K.

description:
This place is ok in the mornings but the price seems more steeper then the other location downtown. The food is great every time i order. For some reason every time I go there seams to
Be a long line in the hallway towards the bathroom. So don't bother going and when you do use the restroom just to wash your hands, There seems to be a little pool on the floor and everything looks wet. Well other then that its ...ok.
author: Anthony G.

description:
The entire menu is inflated compared to other Burger Kings I've been to. Maybe it's because it's deep in the city, but my money can get me a better meal deal elsewhere.

The bathrooms are protected from squatters with a token system, but it's still nasty inside.

The saving point from a 1-star rating: Backstreet Boys on the radio.
author: Paolo V.

description: It smells of homeless people even at 5AM. Watch your back.
author: Justin S.

description:
I know what you are thinking...

Is she crazy. Reviewing another Burger King joint.

Yes, I admit I am a little cray-cray from time to time and like any person or should I say SOME people crave a little fast food at times. It is funny because there are many other options in the area to eat and this  place comes in mind sometimes. What surprises me is that this place is always packed during the afternoon with people eating and long lines. The worker's keep it moving too. There are a few shaddy characters, but let that not stop you if you need a fast food fix.

I like the Chicken Sandwiches and Whoppers. I am not a fan of the French fries, however the milkshakes are not that bad. 

P.S if you add a little tomato and cheese to the chicken sandwich it doesn't taste too bad.

It's alright to come here.
author: Dani D.

description: Not the best but not the worst they have the space and the right location but for some reason they got rid of sweet tea and that's all I drink and haven't brought it back yet
author: Christopher L.

description: Correction: This Burger King is closed for remodeling.  Hope they clean up and police their customers.
author: Clarice L.

description:
Walked in on a scorching day to buy myself an one dollar icee. 

No one was taking orders. I had to wait a whole minute before anyone noticed and took my order. 

It was just an icee and it took the two boys 5 minutes to pull the lever to get my cherry icee. 

Slow service for a slow day. I was the only one in line.
author: Sarah C.

description: I decided to pop in before going to work because my hunger was REAL. I got the sausage and egg  sandwich, hash brown and iced coffee and it was decent. For 8 dollars, you can't go wrong with that. Overall, had a filling breakfast so no complaints.
author: Leslie M.

description:
strap yourself in for a wild ride at this excellent bk location. 

I had just been promoted to CEO of a very promising start up, Singlefy. We aim to make breakups not just easier, but more user friendly. 

Riding high on the success train, I knew the reward i was so deserving of - a freshly ray cooked char-flavor Whopper. Never one to hold back, i asked for extra mayonnaise - which to my utter delight was complimentary! My cashier, Tran, was a doll.

The atmosphere is great, too. Being surrounded by the  beauty of downtown SF and all her colorful locals is almost as delicious as the diet friendly SatisFries. 

Will definitely be celebrating here more often! 

ciao
author: Merland S.

description: This Burger King is an ok location. They could do better by cleaning the outside and inside. Also there are too many people inside. So you are better off going somewhere els to eat.
author: Isaac H.

description: changing my review from 4 stars to 1 cause they just charged me 55¢ for a soda refill. really? ok. guess i'll just eat at every other fast food place downtown that isn't run by cheapasses instead.
author: Lars A.

description:
Do not bother trying their cilantro lime fish sandwich. I should not have been surprised by the lack of flavor, more like synthetic flavored lime. The onion rings were forgettable. Stick to the Whopper.

Also, do they plan on remodeling anytime soon??? I feel like I'm stuck in a time warp circa 1987. I give them props for taking your order quickly and getting it out.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Saturday night in The City. I'm at BK on Powell eating a whopper. Really, seriously?

Me, Cinzia and Reno just went to see the Union Square Christmas Tree, we needed food, they wanted BK.  I love my kids. 
But my whopper was really bad.

I have to say that as we walked in, I told my kids that if it was too dirty or otherwise unseemly, I reserved the right to can out and pick somewhere else. I think bc of the Christmas Tree and Ice Skating nearby, the crowd at BK was a bit more fam friendly than usual. And it was surprisingly clean.

Still, my whopper sucked. And oh yeah, if you're looking for a straw, the dispenser is, umm, on top of the garbage bin.
author: Meg W.

description: Yes, a review for Burger King -- seeing as this is one of the only fast food joints in the entire city of San Francisco.  I was in rush and ran in to grab a bite for lunch and it was an okay experience.  It's a huge place, definitely the touristy crowd as it's right off the cable car line, but all in all, not bad!
author: Mel G.

description:
Can't believe Burger King stuck around while McDonald went away...

Don't remember the last time we had Burger King...it was about 3:30pm and we haven't eaten anything all day...shopping last minute is not an easy task.  While we would much prefer to be serviced in a comfortable place over a glass of wine, we ended up here for speed.

They really need to spruce up this place - it's looking dumpy.  Plenty traffic with lots of families and teens.  

We had the whopper meal, large sized and a chicken sandwich.  It did its job and filled out tummies.
author: Gloria H.

description: why the bad reviews? located right by west field mall.  and right next door to sephora.  i guess the prices are a lil higher than usual but thats cause its sf.  maybe homeless people stay in and it smells.  but why linger in burger king.  just come in and leave.  its called fast food.  ive never had a problem with order before.  always got it right.  got my free satisfries this weekend.  a lil too thick in my opinion.  i prefer del taco crinkle cut fries.  make them monster! but no del taco in bay area.  only la.  boo.  anyways whoppers are always reliable and so are the long chicken sandwiches.  burger king just keeps making burgers to copy mcdonalds.  and i think its working.  i always get a seat when i eat here.  pretty big inside.  no parking so take bart.  its close anyways.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Normally I don't do reviews for massive corporations like BK, Wal-Mart, or McD's anymore... they're all so generic. But this place was unique. I pass this particular BK many many times, but never noticed how unique it was inside.

1. Restrooms: I didn't see any openly visible public restroom in the joint.
2. Food Quality and Pricing: the Steakhouse Burger I ordered was a little on the stale side... it cost 4.79 w/ .46 tax.
3. What Makes It Super Unique: this was probably the largest lobby I've ever laid eyes on, for a fast food establishment. There were so many seats. It's hard to imagine the place ever filling up to the point that there is no more seating for a customer, so s/he would have to go outside to eat.
4. Location: something complementing the unique spacing inside, is that it's located very conveniently near BART, across the Westfield Mall, next to cable cars, and MUNI buses.
5. The Backdoor: there's a subtle, fishy-looking backdoor to this place... which also adds to its unique appeal.  =) 

Enter from front... or from BACK, which I did, hahaha.
author: Carl Z.

description:
A police officer on duty means you're in an authentic Burger King.  Shit just got real.  

We got into town after most restaurants had closed, and we weren't interested in fighting for stools at a crowded bar.  Enter BK.  

It's a very open, cafeteria-style setup.  You probably don't want to eat somewhere that resembles a cafeteria, but remember, you're eating at Burger King, so the idea of fine dining isn't anywhere near this discussion.
author: John H.

description: Food is cheap. Great location to people watch - right outside a cable-car turnaround. A prominent sign made me laugh: It said said something like, "We don't accept Burger King coupons. Sorry for the inconvenience." lol OK, so if Burger Kind doesn't take Burger King coupons, then who does??? And "Sorry for the inconvenience?" Isn't that a weird thing to say after making up a rule to take more money from people? It's like, yes, of course we COULD take Burger King coupons if we wanted to, seeing as we're a Burger King and everything, but we don't want to. So, sorry for the inconvenience! lol
author: Aleks O.

description:
This is the worst fucking Burger King I've ever eaten at. Right off the bat, you'll notice that there are a ton of homeless people as soon as you walk in. They smell worse than a shit/puke mixture and therefore eating inside really isn't an option. Of course, this is a symptom of being in Shit Francisco, but it still has to be mentioned. When you step up to the register, you'll notice a piece of paper behind the counter which states that this BK doesn't take any coupons, ever. Great. Next, if you try to order a limited time specialty burger that most any other BK has (for example, I tried ordering the $1 BK Bacon Burger) you'll learn that this BK doesn't really do the whole specialty burger thing. All these things are fucking awful, but they don't compare to the biggest turd in this giant shit-pile: they don't have a fucking dollar menu! Items that cost a dollar at any other Burger King cost a whopping $1.69 here! Almost two bucks for a fucking Spicy Chick'n? Eat my dick! The final straw is that they have arcade games which cost $1.00 for a credit.

I eat at the Jackson St. McDonald's in Oakland all the time. That place is a shithole. But this Burger King makes that place look like a fine dining experience.
author: Andreas M.

description:
Like any BK is going to get a five star rating... lol.

Anyway, whenever being tight on money and starving... my boyfriend and I always stop in here to grab something to eat.

It's not the cleanest and this place is infested with poor and ghetto people and their service isn't the best either.

But what do you expect?
author: Mimi N.

description:
Where do homeless people go to shower, shoot up and shit?  welcome to the Powell St. Burger King bathroom where you can explore a plethora of smells and filth.

The food ain't that great either.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Ok, it's not healthy. Yes, I know. 

You go to BK for cheap food. 

Now, when I walked in the other day to grab a bunch of stuff from the dollar menu and they responded with "this BK doesn't have the dollar menu."

F*ck that. 

If they went me to spend $7 on a BK meal I can go to at least 500 other places in SF with better food. 

That's all.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Why do people even bother reviewing burger king on yelp...

This is not the cleanest BK in the world.
author: Michael E.

description:
I am not a fast food eater generally and if I was asked to rank the fast food chains I would typically put Burger King at the bottom of the heap.  I don't like the coating on their fries and the lettuce on their Whoppers usually is bitter (Just from what I remember).  Now, I haven't eaten at Burger King in YEARS because I think poorly of the place, so maybe things have changed.  

BK sent me some decent coupons in the mail.  I was totally their intended target audience.  

1) BK hater or BK ignorant
2) not a typical fast food eater
3) hadn't eaten at BK in years

So I kept the coupons and brought them to work.  Yesterday I forgot my lunch (again) and decided to walk about 12 blocks to the restaurant and use my coupons and give BK a chance.  I expected to take the food to go because I expected a high population of undesirables in the restaurant, but was pleasantly surprised to see a minimum and actually planned to eat there.  After my long walk, I select my coupons and approach the register to order.  ERRRRRRRP (skid sound)

"We don't take coupons at this location" said the sweet clerk.  She was nice and friendly.

No problem, I left and went to Chipotle instead.  I wasn't willing to pay full price for BK food.  The very enticing BK marketing initiative gets crushed by the coupon policy and BK doesn't get that slim chance to get out from under the bottom of my heap.

:)
author: Brad B.

description: They don't take coupons, staff is rude and the prices are alot more than any other Burger King. Stay Away.
author: Jay L.

description:
This particular Burger King could have sad songs and philosophical essays written about it.  It is big with low ceilings, blue florescent lights that make everything look dead, and is full of people who are variously broken down, tired people who have finished their vacations and are sitting with their Luggage having a last meal in SF and denizens of the TL.  It's the House of Broken Vacation Dreams.

This place makes fast food restaurants look bad, and for that, it gets a low rating from a girl who loves her fast food.
author: Lauren J.

description: It's pretty dang large in here ... they were cleaning both in and out of here. 2 for $4 croissant breakfast. it's a deal. but as I held it... it's a pretty durn small breakfast ... ATM located at the wait line
author: Dany B.

description: Place is really big, but they don't take any coupons, staff is rude. No reason to eat here unless you're desperate. One bright spot was a server saw I was carrying a tray of drinks and put 4 straws on my tray, which was nice. Also, note that you have to pay to use the bathroom here.
author: Vinay Y.

description:
ya might wonder... why anyone would bother 2write a review on a national-chain fast food no less.  Simple, its EVERYWHERE! plus they give you a CROWN.

I like trying all kinds of $1 food just to see if its worth the buck.  So, the other morning i tried their $1 breakfast sandwich.  Guess what?! they have in 3 different styles to choose from.  I order my usual favorite combo of Sausage (patti), egg, cheese in between their muffin.  It was good and definitely worth the BUCK!
author: LindaLu N.

description:
Not a big fan of this chain restaurants so this is kind of biased. 

Although I've had a lot of good times with Burger King back in the past, times have changed. No more itching to see which toy I got from their kids meal. No more green colored ketchup from their Nickelodeon slime promotion. Worst of all, no more craves for their dollar double cheeseburgers. Ok, the last one is a lie, haha. 

This particular BK is huge. Lots of seats to welcome the hordes of people in this one little section on downtown who are hungry after their shopping sprees. One of the reasons I don't like this place much is the amount of bums here. Another reason is I think the prices are higher here than other BKs! I'd rather spend the money on a slice at Blondie's than for an overpriced cheeseburger. 

The few things I get at BK are the double cheeseburgers and the tacos. I used to love these two things. Two patties with melted cheese, pickle slices, and 2 buns pressed against on the outside. That used to hit the spot and clog the arteries. I also really liked their tacos back in the day. Greasy, crunchy, and best of all, spicy. It would make my cousin's nose run like a water hose. 

However times expectations change. I'm sure there are better BK's, but this one is just too messy and crowded. I know I'm asking a lot since probably hundreds of people stop by here everyday, but this place just doesn't cut it for me as much as it used to.
author: robin w.

description: It probably better to come here after 1000pm.  The service was fast but i just order two single stackers for 2.16 dollar and left. Then on my way to work the graveyard.
author: John F.

description: This is by far the worst burger king I've ever been to. It's messy, and the workers there are rude and unfriendly. I ordered the chicken tenders and fries.  When the lady asked me do I want ketchup and sauce for the chicken tenders I said yes. She gave me one ketchup and one ranch dressing. I asked her for more packets of ketchup. The lady said if I want more, I have to pay for it. I was like "WTF????!!!?????, this ain't Europe where people have to pay for asking for more ketchup." I won't be coming back here.
author: Jessica C.

description: All the ice cream machines don't work in SF. The chicken sandwich was so simple. I am not going back.
author: Gelbert D.

description: I come here all the time caus it's close to the mall and open so late, and there is so much sitting room, and semi-available bathrooms (You have to buy something to get a token to use the bathroom, or pay a quarter). But the food is SO OVERPRICED, and not that delicious. I paid nearly $10 for an imitation McNuggets meal, and it was just really sad.
author: Melody L.

description:
I love Whoppers, but other than that, I really have no need to ever go to a BK. 

Doos~ Buy me a MEAL!
author: Chum L.

description:
"Try a Coke Icee Float!" Said the sign...

Soft Serve Ice Cream and Coke Icee is an unholy combination that leaves you feeling violated.
author: Michelle B.

description:
My "power walk" up Nob Hill took me past this icon of Corporate America, and suddenly I decided it was time for lunch.  

Don't hate.  BK and I have a history together.  For six years, it fed me the best lunch in Mountain View, considering the benefit/cost ratio.  

I can't go back to the land where every third person had a PhD, and they adorned their cubicles with plaques showing their patent numbers.  I can't go back to the Chinese restaurant where six of my classmates high-fived each other, because Cisco bought their company and they were all millionaires that day.  I can't go back to the parks where the CEO would tap a keg with 3,000 employees, and anyone could talk with him.  I can't go back to the flight simulators where Grok and Skeeter and Bushmaster practiced air-to-air combat, powered by the computers we had designed and built.  I wouldn't want to, anyway.  All of that disappeared with the Turn of the Century, and I'm a City Boy who prefers City Life.  

I can go back to the watered-down Coke, the thin-cut meat-flavored fries, and the smoky-flavored burger with the grill marks on it.  That's right, a Whopper, small fries and a small Coke for just $5.52.  The taste is still the same.  

And as for jogging my way to the front door of a fast food chain?  Bill Clinton would have been proud.
author: David D.

description:
I am embarrassed to admit that I ate here today. I don't eat here often, but it is pretty cheap and I have yet to be impressed by any food in this area - it is all overpriced mall food. I am a vegetarian so the menu is limited for me. I ate the BK veggie burger meal. I did not realize how truly large a size medium has become. I left feeling full but mildly ill and bloated. I gave it 2 stars for location and price, $5.50 for a veggie burger, soda & fries is not too bad. The crowd in line is sort of sad though...it makes me think twice about obesity and poverty. The bathroom is scary, don't go there.

Maybe I should have skip it, spends the extra $3 and got something healthy.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
"Alright stop what you're doin' 'cause I'm about to ruin the image and the style that you're used to.."

Once touted by the likes of Humpty Hump as having great restrooms for getting busy in, I found that trying for a quickie here was not all that. Sorry Humpty, or is it Shock G? For my quickies, I'm going elsewhere!

1. Restroom decor leaves something to be desired. The Jackson Pollack motif surrounding the toilet was vaguely horrifying. 

2. Had to ask for a key. This totally hurt the spontaneity of the moment.. 

3. Out of paper towels. Messy Messy. 

I'd say push on the Carl's Junior up the street for a far improved sketchy liaison.
author: Brian S.

description:
Don't let the haters tell you otherwise... when you are down on your luck -- the women don't like your balding, no one respects you, etc... no one loves you unconditionally like a Whopper does. 

When I am feeling bad about myself after being treated particularly badly by a SF woman who finds me repulsive, I always treat myself to a Whopper and my problems just melt away.

A helpful tip about this particular location: Stay away from the long hallway in back. For some reason, it ALWAYS smells like puke. With all the homeless guys who hang out here and outside, I am not suprised.

Whopper with cheese and bacon, extra pickles, extra onions with a jumbo onion rings and ranch dressing. Pure bliss.

Thank you Comfort Whopper. I no longer care that I am asexual. You are all that I need.
author: OL G.

description: There is a MASSIVE lobby, fully staffed the line moves through quickly and there is always somewhere to sit when you're by yourself or with one other person. If you come in a group you'll need to spit up.
author: Sean W.

description: Smells like weed, shit, and puke. Homeless people inside. Its loud. Ate a whopper junior. It gave my heartburn. Urghh. I only came because I was starving. The burger was all flat and everything was falling out. I got my order in under 5 minutes. I wouldn't come here again, or any Burger King at all. I'm not going to risk a heart attack. This place is just gross..
author: M P.

description:
I'm embarrassed that I even eat here. I can handle the jokes and snide comments from my vegetarian friends when I eat bacon wrapped hot dogs, those babies are delicious. But BK? I have no excuse.

A Whopper with Cheese, plus fries and a drink comes out to almost $7. You can get real food, good food, in San Francisco for that price! No excuse at all.

It definitely didn't make my experience any less bad when people started asking me for money while I was eating.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I can't believe I actually ate here last weekend. 

About 6 months ago, I almost got into a fight with a smelly homeless guy while waiting in line for the restroom. He yelled at me to "Go back to China!" while all the other bathroom patrons waited in line too scared to intervene on my behalf. The GF also happened to be one of the onlookers.

My feelings were hurt and I cried myself to sleep that night.
author: Jay W.

description: Good location, lots of seating. Went in to grab a drink and wait for friend after a whole afternoon of shopping. Service was quick and cashier was friendly. Don't know about their food though...I guess if you are in the area shopping and wanted a quick bite, this is the place to go to.
author: Lulu S.

description:
I get a Fast Food craving about once a week, and only eat BK.  Usually this is satisfied at the Channing location in San Jose, but being a short week, that wasn't an option so I stopped in.  Ooops.

Whopper had a stale bun and brown lettuce.

Fries were cold and not tasty.

Coke tasted funny.

Then again, it wasn't all bad.  Hella convenient location between my bus stop and the BART, plus no line.  

Also, it's big for an inner-city BK, and has mirrors to make it look bigger.  While eating, I caught a good glimpse of myself:

"Jeez, Johnny.  Here you are in SF and you're dressed sloppy, 10 lbs overweight, and eating at Burger King.  What the hell, man?"

Who needs Anthony Robbins or David DeAngelo when you've got the Powell St. BK?
author: John H.

description:
Well yeah I know it's just a Burger King, but if you are a vegetarian in need of a quick fix in between H&M and Urban Outfitters sessions, this is the place to be.

Yes! They carry veggie patties, and have always had them in stock when I've dropped in. I haven't asked them to prepare them in a microwave or on a separate grill though, but BK's are SUPPOSED to honor that request...
author: Trey F.

description:
Burger King at Powell street is whole in the wall haven for low lifes and the homeless.

If you enjoy dining in a run down establishment, this bk is for you.

The food at best is average.  The whoppers look nothing like on tv.  Theres no flame broiled nothing to there burgers.

All you taste is tons of mayonaise and bland meat. 

Save your hard earned money and go to in and out instead.
author: JERRY B.

description:
Uh, dirty, empty, kind of unwelcoming. We were hungry. We got our food fast, at least. Hobos here and there. People seem to stare at you in here. 

We put on sunglasses & and ate our burgers. Then we left.

I got a tummyache :(
author: M J.

description:
I remember as a kid sitting at this location and just enjoying my little burger in the bright, clean BK downtown..

today, That image is just shattered.. I even question myself if what I remembered was real..

You got the 'eccentrics' (my nice term for scary people) there, as well as the tourists, and it's rather shotty in there..

One time, I asked for a double cheese burger meal.. A MEAL.. Later, I found that I had just 'ordered' ONLY the double cheeseburger itself, forcing me to go back to the cashier and ask for the complete meal to add-on..
Another time, when I JUST WANTED a cherry-limeade ICEE, one of the other employees went to talk to the other cashier, JUST WHEN IT WAS MY TURN! Waited a good extra minute just standing in front of her..

granted, much like my local mcdonalds location, I will still go here only for convenience of a BK craving..

But maybe for my next visit, I'll just take a to-go..
author: Nicolo T.

description: Ever since the McDonald's next door left Powell Street some years ago, this Burger King is really your best bet for your typical fast food fare in the immediate area. Whenever I am in the area, I usually order their world famous Double Whopper with Onion Rings--tasty food for the price.
author: Robert T.

description: Alright, I confess I love the Rodeo Cheeseburger. It's just a cheeseburger with barbecue sauce and some onion rings. This location is pretty filthy and disgusting and it is the walk of shame after you eat here. I always throw away the evidence so no one knows where I really went for lunch. (the receipt, the cup, everything must go). Eating alone here is even more depressing. I have definitely been harassed in here, but yes, I will go back for that damn Rodeo Cheeseburger. (and proceed to feel like shit afterwards, since BK always gives you a stomachache).
author: Kristy H.

description:
my personal beef with this place is that it's still here, while the McDonald's that used to be next door sold out and became a friggin Sephora.  boo!!!!!

back when both BK & McD were still around, the only times i ever go to BK was because McD had a long line and no more tables available.  the food and ambience at McD was better, and McD was always cleaner.  the interior of this BK is pretty grungy..... you'd expect this from a BK in the crappy part of town, not one within the prime real estate of downtown SF/Union Square.  

i came in here today hoping to take advantage of the $1 double cheeseburger deal.  of course, they're not participating in that.  so they most likely won't accept any official BK coupons either.  screw them..... i'd rather starve than come back here again.
author: Sheldon M.

description: am i the only one that thinks this place is kinda strange cause its like a mile long??? but hey that's san francisco for you
author: Dylan H.

description:
First and foremost i would like to say that I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! the service is not only fast but its very efficient. I've been going to this place since i was little (i'm not obese) and it's always fast. I noticed that they upgraded they're machines so the service is FASTER!!! BTW make sure you go during the day because their cashiers are HOT!!!
The burgers are always hot and the french are always crunchy to my liking. So if you are downtown for a night of drinking make sure you stop by BK and order a Steak Burger, it taste delicious!!!
author: Carlitos B.

description: Oh... man... The only good thing about this Burger King is that they are fast and have a lot of seatings. If I'm hungry and stingy, this is where I can go to buy breakfast food. Most of the people who eat here are creepy people. There's a whole pile of bird crap right when you walk to the door. When I had to go use the women's bathroom, I put in the token and there was a homeless couple sexing it up in there. And then they finally leave and they looked like they wanted to jump me. They stank so bad too that I lost my appetite and couldn't eat my chicken fries anymore.
author: Christine N.

description: Yuck, I hate all fast food, so maybe this is an unfair judgement...but I can appreciate a good burger from time to time. I was walking around, shopping...when I realized that I hadn't eaten in a long time and I was starting to feel faint. I didn't want to buy anything super expensive...that's when my eyes laid upon that bk sign. bleh. So I went in and ordered a veggie burger [figured it'd be the safest thing]. It was nasty! It was all mushy and had a wierd flavor to it...and I normally LOVE veggie burgers.  Towards the end, as I was walking out the door, I realized that there was something hard and unchewable in my mouth that tasted faintly of chicken. I promptly spit it out...it was fucking disusting. I felt blah for the rest of the day. Never again...I'd rather go hungry..
author: NF T.

description: Well here's my rant. Everytime I went to this Burger King, within an hour I had to use the bathroom. The service here sucks, the eating enviornment sucks, let's face it, this place is a dump and I always had to take a dump after eating here. Also got into an argument with the manager because I had a coupon and they wouldn't take it. At least put up a sign saying we don't except coupons or something. In conclusion, this place sucks...
author: Henry C.

description: This is one of the fast food places that I would go to if I was seriously short on cash was starving. That just happened. The line was really long no kidding. I ordered a burger, just one. It took like 10 minutes and then they called out the wrong number and was about to put it back, until I asked. Decent prices, food and service not so great. But, hey if you were in my situation, I'm pretty sure you would take a try at it.
author: Jenny L.

description: I like the fact that there is a Burger King on the bustling Powell street.  I have been going  to this establishment for 10 years.  The food has always been consistent and getting a seat is never a problem.  What I like most about this place is the BK whopper or the Big Fish.  Food is always hot and if I wanted extra pickles I get it my way.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I know it's just Burger King and it's not supposed to be great...but charging people to go use the restroom? That's a crime against humanity. The BK King needs to be hauled off to the ICC.
author: Darwin F.

description: As an employee in the dowtown area i look for convenience, speed and taste (only having a 30 minute lunch break) I must say i'm a very picky person and this BK gets it down to exact detail. Rodeo burger off the broiler, extra bbq sauce with french fries no salt and sprite/ lemonade!!! very fast service i don't know why people complain about the place, what do you expect for fast food. Do you want a candle light dinner. All i need is this friendly service!!!
author: Joann H.

description: The food at this Burger King is actually pretty good, just remember to take it to go.  The last time I was there one of the customers decided to change her baby diaper on one of the tables, and I have also seen some homeless people eating in the restaurant.
author: Patty G.

description: This is a great place to shoot up heroin in the bathroom. You know, if you're into that sort of thing.
author: Alexis C.
